review: I've had my Apple TV for about two years now and a month ago I bought a BluRay player with wifi. I spent $99 on my Apple TV and $55 on my Sony BluRay player, and if I had to give one up, I'd give up my Apple TV. The BluRay player lets you access everything the Apple TV does and much, much more including your Amazon purchases. The only thing the BluRay player doesn't have is iTunes, but that's something I can live with. In addition, you can also play BluRay discs and regular DVDs as well. The only pluses the Apple TV has are that it has a smaller footprint and the interface is more attractive, but I have plenty of room and as long as it does what it's supposed to do, I don't care what the menu looks like. Like Apple TV, you can also control the BluRay player using the TVSideView app on your iPhone. I love Apple products, but save your money and get more bang for your buck with a BluRay player with wifi instead of this.
